galaxies.name: Milky Way Galaxy
galaxies.description: The galaxy that includes our solar system. It is a hazy band of white light which originates from the accumulation of unresolved stars. It is the second largest galaxy after the Andromeda Galaxy.

galaxies.name: Andromeda Galaxy
galaxies.description: It is a spiral galaxy, closest to the Milky Way Galaxy. It is the largest galaxy and in about 4.5 billion years from now the Andromeda Galaxy and the Milky Way galaxy will merge to form a new single galaxy which will be called the Milkdromeda Galaxy.

galaxies.name: Antennae Galaxies
galaxies.description: It is a pair of interacting galaxies in the Corvus constellation which is under a starbust phase.

galaxies.name: Backward Galaxy
galaxies.description: It is a face-on unbarred spiral galaxy in the Centaurus constellation.

galaxies.name: Black Eye Galaxy
galaxies.description: It is a dark band of aborbing dust partially in front of its bright nucleus. This galaxy looks like a black eye and is named after so.
